article.headline: Mnuchin, Powell testify before House panel on coronavirus aid: live blog
article.body: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Tuesday are testifying before the Democratic-run House Financial Services Committee, giving their latest assessment of the federal government’s response to the coronavirus crisis. The hearing, which began around 12:45 p.m. Eastern Time, is a hybrid event, with lawmakers taking part remotely and in person. Follow along with MarketWatch’s live updates below. The main U.S. stock gauges SPX, +0.87% DJIA, +0.56% COMP, +1.39% were recently trading mostly higher.
